intro: Calophanoides kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi calophanoides, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Calophygiaceae and is characterized by its unique, delicate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its foliage consists of lanceolate leaves with a smooth surface and a distinct midrib. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
